about_the_game:
Scritch Scratch


What terror lurks within the gloomy woodlands surrounding a sleepy English village?

For two to six players, Scritch Scratch and can be played in one or two sessions. Set in the modern-day, in a quiet valley somewhere in the north of England, this adventure concerns the demise of an age-old tradition in the quaint village of Muscoby--and the consequences of forgetting the Old Ways.

Muscoby has never not had a rat catcher. Old Gurteen has been carrying on the tradition in the village, but recently he was involved in an accident and is now hospitalized. With Old Gurteen away, who will ensure the rat population is kept in check?

Six pre-generated investigators are provided for use with this scenario, which is a great introduction to Call of Cthulhu while also being a suitably mysterious and horri-fic evening of fun for more experienced players.

This product includes:

  • 6 pre-generated characters
  • Portrait pack
  • 15 images and maps
  • 28 story entries
  • 7 NPCs and monsters

By Lynne Hardy and Friends

Editing and Development by Mike Mason

Front Cover and Interior Art by Joel Holtzmann

Cartography by Matt Ryan

What's in the Cellar?


Will your investigators escape from the myserious tomb?

A One Hour Demo Scenario for Call of Cthulhu

This product includes:

  • 4 pre-generated characters
  • 20 story entries
  • 3 images and maps
  • 1 NPC

Written by Jon Hook

Editing and Development by Mike Mason

Dead Boarder


Extended Demo Scenario for Call of Cthulhu

This product includes:

  • 6 pre-generated Characters
  • 28 story entries
  • 3 images and maps
  • 3 NPCs
  • 2 Spells

By Todd Gardiner

Written by Todd Gardiner with Mike Mason

Development and Editing by Mike Mason

Cartography by Todd Gardiner

Camp Sunny


What could possibly go wrong during a vacation at an off-season summer camp?
A Convention Scenario for Call of Cthulhu

This product includes:

  • 6 pre-generated characters
  • Portrait pack
  • 1 image/map
  • 30 story entries
  • 5 NPCs

Based on an Original Idea by Keary Birch

Written by Paul Frickerwith Mike Mason

Development and Editing by Mike Mason

Converted by: Aleksandar Velkov

Released on February 04, 2019. Designed for Fantasy Grounds version 3.3.6 and higher.

Requires: An active subscription or a one time purchase of a Fantasy Grounds Full or Ultimate license and a one time purchase of the Call of Cthulhu 7E ruleset.
